results.description:
This event is hosted by Embody Healing, LLC and presented by Rebekah Gamble, holistic practitioner. Here are the details: After several events with clients, students and in the workshop on past life work, it became fairly obvious that there are a lot of people who are suffering from soul contracts made in past lives and by ancestors that are no longer serving them and that they need a bit of help releasing. We're going to do a brief intro where I explain how this works, what you need to know, and what you need to know about this ritual. Then we will walk through the ritual which will be broadcast, though you are encouraged to perform it at home as well individually along with me. This ritual will use shamanic and witchcraft elements while having a strong basis in psychology. I will explain everything before the actual ritual so you can do what suits your beliefs and needs best, and even suggest modifications to consider before we begin.

How do you know is a past life or ancestral contract is affecting you? This might be the problem if:

-You are in a relationship where both of you are ready to move on but you can't seem to just finish it.
-No matter what you do, all your efforts with work and career still leave you impoverished.
-You struggle with problems around freedom, being free, or taking responsibility.
-Your ancestors were victims of genocide, rape, colonization or another like situation and you carry anger, grief or bitterness over it.
-You seem to repeat the same relationship problems in different people.
-You dream of being a slave or other bonded person and can't shake the idea that you'll never be free.
-You can't seem to have a relationship that lasts or you have ongoing sexual problems that damage relationships.

The cost of the event is $10. You will need to pre-pay to get the link to the event emailed to you. The link will be emailed out about 15 minutes before the event. You will also need a mirror, white candle, and something to write on and with to participate. You can pre-pay by sending a payment via Paypal to [masked] with a note of what it's for, or you can email me at the same address and I can send you an invoice (which can be paid with paypal or a card).

If you'd like, you can also purchase a ritual kit at Sparkledragon's Magical Emporium, who has generously offered to carry 25 kits for this ritual. The kits include a mirror, white candle, essential oils roll on to help the process energetically and to trigger helpful responses in the brain, and three helpful gemstones. The kits are $20 each. At this time there are only 25 kits. They will be available on April 7, 2016 until they're gone!

If you'd like to take advantage of the essential oil benefits but aren't planning to buy a kit, here's the ingredients so you can make your own: Fractionated coconut oil, Royal Hawaiian Sandalwood oil (Santalum paniculatum), Boswellia carteri (Frankincense) resin oil, Boswellia sacra (Sacred frankincense) oil, Picea mariana (Spruce) leaf oil, Picea pungens† (Idaho blue spruce) branch/leaf/wood oil, Cedrus atlantica (Cedarwood) bark oil, Myrtus communis (Myrtle) oil, Coriandrum sativum (Coriander) seed oil, Citrus aurantium bergamia (Furanocoumarin-free Bergamot peel oil, Nardostachys jatamansi (Spikenard) oil, Vetivera zizandoides (Vetiver) root oil, Cananga odorata (Ylang ylang) flower oil, Pelargonium graveolens (Geranium) flower oil, Citrus limon (Lemon) peel oil, Mentha piperita (Peppermint) oil, Salvia sclarea (Clary) oil, Elettaria cardamomum (Cardamom) seed oil, Ocotea quixos (Ocotea) leaf oil, Bursera graveolens (Palo santo) wood oil
results.name: Soul Contract Release Event (Online!)

results.description:
There is no requirement to register and no cost. All participants must be well. Please do bring your baby with you.

Pregnant mothers, currently breastfeeding mothers, mothers who are pumping and bottlefeeding, mothers who have breastfed in the past are all welcome to participate.

Meetings are led by a lactation consultant from Heritage Valley Sewickley. There is a scale available for weighing babies. Some meetings focus on a particular topic, but generally there is no specific topic. Specific topics can be addressed if requested by group participants.

Meetings of the Breastfeeding Moms Network are normally held on the 2nd and 4th Thursday evening of the month--except November and December when it is only the 2nd Thursday evening.

Storkbites is for all new mothers with a baby under a year old. Those meetings are on Tuesday mornings and moms can attend whether they are breast or formula feeding their babies.
results.how_to_find_us: Meetings are held on the 6th floor of the hospital in the Maternal Child Health classroom. There are blue signs posted on the evenings when there are meetings, to help you find the classroom.
results.name: Breastfeeding Moms Network

I say this, because many Americans have reached a plateau in their language learning - and this is totally normal.  BUT in order to progress to the next level, some heavy lifting is in order. 

Homework (reading, writing, listening) will be assigned, also.

results.description:
An advance welcome to you – our prospective guest…

Perhaps you’ve been thinking about going to a Toastmasters meeting for awhile.

Maybe you’re not quite certain what to expect, and so you’ve hesitated.

Given that fear of public speaking has ranked as the top phobia for quite some time, you’ve got plenty of company! At the same time, the most important skill, and it is indeed a “skill” -- not something that one is born with, or is “automatically” comfortable and effective for anyone -- is communication.

How we communicate influences most every aspect of our personal and professional lives. Wherever you happen to be in your communications process, the supportive environment of our club can make a positive difference. As renowned and respected motivational speaker Les Brown has maintained throughout his impressive career, “Practice makes improvement.”

You may notice that the emphasis is NOT upon perfection, but rather, upon effort and growth, over the course of time. We hope that you will consider Club 1104 – Penn Hills Toastmasters as a place where you can feel comfortable and encouraged as you embark upon your path to improved communication.

See you at the next meeting!

http://1104.toastmastersclubs.org/

results.description: The "Incito Veritas" founding fathers (which included females, of course, as no soul has a gender) originally called this group "Fight Club" and first intended to keep that name while maintaining secrecy. So much for that. But the spirit of Fight Club remains, the idea of trying to bring out the best in each other through the evolution of consciousness. As Brad Pitt said about the movie, "Fight Club is a metaphor for the need to push through the walls we put around ourselves and just go for it." And not fear the pain! In this meetup we discuss ways that concepts introduced during the Incito Veritas series can be applied to our daily lives. We will learn and grow as we process our experiences. Bottom line: Knowing and Not Doing is Not Knowing, or as it says in James 2:26, "For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead."
results.name: Fight Club: Ready ... Set ... Action!

results.description:
Hello everyone!

Today's board games come in all different shapes, sizes, themes, components, and our group plays all kinds.. Here are some examples of the types of games we play... 

Party games like: Codenames, Spyfall, and Dixit.

Euro style games like: Five Tribes, Orleans, Puerto Rico,Viticulture, and Lords of Waterdeep. 

Abstract games like: Qwirkle, Blokus, and Hive

Card games like: Dominion, Glory to Rome, Diamonds, andMunchkin

Those are just a few of the games that can be seen being played at our meetups every week.

Our members come in all shapes and sizes and span from young to older but all seem to have a great time when we get together!

Our organizers try to be very accommodating to new players and try to pick games appropriate to your skill level and that we think you would enjoy.  Our goal is to get you enthusiastic about the hobby.

If there is a game that you would like to try out just r.s.v.p. to one of our meetups and suggest it down in the chat.  Chances are that one of us has it in our collection and we can bring it out.

Look forward to introducing the hobby to many more players in 2016 and continued good times with our regulars.

Please r.s.v.p. early so I have an idea on how many people or coming and what games to bring along.  You can always cancel your r.s.v.p. if you have a change of plans. 

See you soon!

results.description:
Hello everyone!

Great meetup last Friday at the Market District!

Check out the pictures that Eddie posted to get an idea of how many and what types of games hit the table.  I personally got my first play of Power Grid in which I enjoyed quite a bit.  Shout out to Redbeard and Brian for teaching me that one.  I will certainly keep it in my collection.  I followed up Power Grid with a game of Airlines Europe.  I don't know why I play games that have a lot of colors in them?  Being color blind stinks but it is a great game and a nice step up from Ticket to Ride but I just can't seem to play very well in this game.   Finally, to cap off the evening got a game of Dead of Winter in.  Things were really bleak for the group but it all came together over the last couple of turns and we managed to beat the group objective.  I had to humanely put down "Sparky the Wonder Dog" during the last round to meet my personal objective but it had to be done!

Looking forward to getting some of my new games to the table this week like: Signorie, Steam Time, and Millenium Blades to the table.

Hope to see you there!

Russ.

results.description:
Come - let us learn how to play American Mah Jongg or seriously play Mah Jongg and have some fun.  Please post that you are a beginner if you need instructions.  I suggest beginners try to get there by 6 pm to allow time to learn and then have a game or two after that. But come whenever you can.

If you plan to eat, try to come earlier or finish your food before you sit in for a game. I found out that Mah Jongg is not a good game to be eating and playing at the same time. Since we are using the facilities of Panera, no outside food or drinks please.  Also please purchase a drink or snack or food to support them for allowing us to use their facilities.


Another group has already reserved the Community Room, so the manager said we could use the bigger round tables outside the Room. It will still be in the back area of the restaurant.


This Panera is on the ground floor of the Quality Inn Hotel. It also has a free parking lot and is on exit 376 to Bates Street to Blvd of the Allies. So it is not right into the narrow, crowded streets of Oakland.
results.how_to_find_us: We should be using some tables outside the Community Room 412-683-9616

results.description:
The month of May at the Artists’ Gallery celebrates the beauty and power of the female form through two unique local artists: Miser and Ty Cairns will explore the shape and form of the female body in this living art gallery exhibition. 

This is a living art exhibition. Models styled for each exhibited artist’s aesthetic will be present and ready for their photos to be taken during the reception. 

Friday, May 27: 6-8 pm     and        Saturday, May 28: 6-8 pm

In addition, all work exhibited will be for sale and ready to be taken home.



Artist Information:


Miser, Using the delicate beauty of the human physique, these photographs employ soft lighting and detailed composition to accent the graceful poses of each subject. The beauty of this series is not the way nudity is employed to create art, but the way each body tells a separate, powerful story. You can follow Miser on Instagram at @miserphoto

Tyler Cairns: I was inspired to be an artist by the loving family who took the time to sit down and draw with me as a small boy. It’s my dream to one day be a successful comic book artist drawing superheroes. You can follow Tyler on Instagram at @tylercairns

Meetup Considerations:

When you RSVP, please indicate (in a comment) whether you're interested in attending on Friday May 27 or Saturday May 28. On both Friday & Saturday nights, the exhibit reception will be from 6 to 8 PM.

As always, it is also OK if you prefer attending on your own with family and friends instead.
results.name: The FEMALE FORM Exhibition: May 27 & 28, 6-8 pm

results.description:
Regular season Friday downtown weekly organized street and trail skate.

Intermediate skaters, helmet and wrist guards required at a minimum for our safety. 2+ hours skating of downtown, S.Side, North Shore, Strip District and other venues around downtown.  Trails, streets, bridges, stadiums, tunnels, Market Square, Station Square and more! See you there for a great tour of the city from the skaters perspective! And get a great workout.

Moderate pace. Urban skate. 10 to 16 miles. Mostly flat type terrain, but some gentler hills and sloped bridge decks and ramps may be encountered. Be able to maneuver in pedestrian and vehicular traffic, negotiate curbs, potholes, speed bumps and other urban amenities. Be able to brake confidently. This is a patrolled skate.

It is suggested that you wear light colored clothes, carry a flashlight, or wear blinkies, or reflective items.  Part of the skate will be completed as darkness is approaching.

Be ready to roll by 6:30 PM. Get there a little early to gear up and get ready to skate!

Frequent tailgate gatherings in the parking lot meeting place after the skate. And other post skate BBQ's, wine tastings, and other gatherings as the season progresses.

Come out and be part of the fun!

Cyclists are welcome to join us! Bike with us to enjoy an evening tour of the city. Also if you have not skated this meetup, biking is a good way to check it out.

NOTE: All skates are weather permitting. If it is dry we should be skating.
results.how_to_find_us: Eliza Furnace (Jail)Trail access parking lot, off 2nd Ave. between the Hot Metal Bridge (28th St.) and the underpass to Greenfield / Hazelwood.  See the attached map if you need directions. "FREE" parking at the trail.
results.name: TRIC/NSP Friday Night City Sights - Weekly Street and Trail Skate

results.description:
Utilizing Amtrak's still relatively new bicycle 'roll-on' service...a small, committed group of no more than 8 (for the train) will embark on a Great Allegheny Passage tour over Memorial Day weekend.  While more specific details will follow--I wanted to post this for the interested...& truly dedicated to be able to decide (& plan) for this mini-(biking) adventure!

The itinerary would be thus...arrive in downtown Cumberland in the 10 AM range, gather ourselves & have a quick bite before heading off & UP [24 miles] past Frostburg to the Eastern Continental Divide.  Because of Meyersdale being booked for that Saturday...Rockwood would now have to be the 1st night's destination.  There is a hostel there that is fairly new & very clean near it's sister business the Grand ol' Opry Pizza/Ice Cream/more.  It makes the mileage 44 miles the first day. The camping option would be at the Husky Haven Campground on the trail but a mile or so from town.  Day 2 will be an overall slightly downward 45 mile descent to Connellsville where, once again...various lodging can be had.  Day 3 will consist of the final 59 mile leg to Pgh.  If at all feasible, a final bite can be had before our diverging routes home.

There are costs associated with this event.   Amtrak ticket from $29 to $56 or more depending on purchase date + $20 bike charge.  Lodging, $10 (camping) to ~$75+ for B&B or other per night, $? meals, drinks, & all other incidentals.  Tons of fun & a memorable LIFETIME experience---FREE! 

I'm setting a FIRM commitment date of April 1, 2016 for train ticket purchase.  I have no idea if this is early enough to ensure availability of not only embarkment but more importantly...bicycle accommodation!  Limit of 8 'roll-on' bikes & there is no checked baggage service of any kind to Cumberland. So, decisions have to be made & committed to e-e-early!  Only those that are definite should sign up beginning March 15th. Conceivably more can go but may have to make their own travel arrangements by commercial shuttle or other means.

Also, a series of various 'training' rides will be available beginning in April or earlier to provide an opportunity to be in a comfortable level of fitness for the trip.  Some attendance encouraged but purely optional.
results.how_to_find_us: Those there with the bicycles...at 5 AM, ha-ha!
results.name: Cumberland, MD to Pgh...3 days, 2 nights.  **Updated**

Visitors Always Welcome!

The Pittsburgh Model Club (East) is sponsored by the Pittsburgh Chapter of BetterInvesting for the purpose of teaching investment club operations and investment decision-making techniques.  This Model Club focuses on using computerized techniques to screen for potential investments, to analyze stocks of interest, and to manage a stock portfolio.

Anyone can attend as a visitor and is eligible to apply for a membership. Visitors are encouraged to participate in our lively discussions (but only members my vote on investment decisions for the club)

Each member invests between $10 and $100 per month and the club maintains an investment portfolio following BetterInvesting procedures.

Prerequisite: A desire to learn about investing or, if you are already an active investor, a desire to improve your investing decisions.

                                           Event Contact:

                                       [masked]<a></a>

results.description:
There has been a lot of talk lately to do a "Street Photography Meetup". Especially from my sister, who loves it. 

Street photography is more than a phrase; it is a way of seeing, a way of experiencing life. At its very essence street photography is capturing life without interrupting it. Witnessing and capturing a once-in-a-lifetime moment as it unfolds in front of you. 

I'm posting a link below that is really worth the read. It's by Eric Kim and it's called, WHAT IS STREET PHOTOGRAPHY?

This is going to be a really fun meet up. We will all meet (Strip location to be announced) and decide where and when we'll meet when finished. Everyone will go off to explore the streets of the Strip District. Later we'll have lunch and talk about our subjects. Of course, lunch is optional. You can even pick up some items for your Memorial Day picnic. 

THE PITTSBURGH STRIP DISTRICT / what better place to explore? 

Combine the hustle and bustle, the nightlife, some of the finest cuisine, the fun of a street carnival, and the atmosphere of days gone by. Add to this a thriving commercial center, and what do you get? Pittsburgh’s Strip District–a place like no other.

Since its founding, Pittsburgh’s Strip District has been a distinctive and vital part of the community and continues to be so today. Just a mile east of downtown, The Strip District has had more identities than an undercover agent, from incubator of early industry and industrial hub to a center for wholesale produce, delightful specialty shops, and incredible restaurants.

The Strip District runs from 11th Street, across from the David L. Lawrence Convention Center, to 33rd Street. This one-mile stretch of land connects downtown Pittsburgh to the city’s Lawrenceville neighborhood, and three major thoroughfares traverse the one-half-mile-square area of land: Smallman Street, Penn Avenue, and Liberty Avenue.

http://erickimphotography.com/blog/2013/08/07/what-is-street-photography-2/
results.name: STREET PHOTOGRAPHY AT THE STRIP DISTRICT

group.name: The Pittsburgh Photo Safari Meetup Group

results.description:
The Pittsburgh One Step Process (http://pittsburghpa.gov/dcp/ada/one-step) was created to make it easier for commercial properties to modify their single-step entrances to allow people of all abilities to do business.

There are many, many businesses in this city that still have a one-step entryway, and one reason is because they are unaware of the One Step Process. For our canvass, we will be surveying a neighbourhood (or several, to be determined depending on number of RSVPs) to assess which businesses have one step to enter, provide information to those businesses, and collect data on the overall condition of sidewalks and business entrances in the area.

I'll set starting and ending locations on or by May 20, depending on how many people RSVP. Invite your friends! The more, the better!

Update: We'll be meeting in front of Zeke's Coffee at 6012 Penn Avenue (buy some coffee! They're super accessible!) and moving out from there. No rain location because if it's raining we're going to cancel the event and try again in better weather. People who arrive later than 10:30 should leave a comment here so I can make sure we can all find each other.
results.name: East End Neighbourhood One Step Process Canvass

results.description:
GET OUT AND DRAW PROGRAM DEBUTS AT PITTSBURGH'S DORMONT PUBLIC LIBRARY
'Superhero of Fun' Mr. Buckethead Leads Inspiring Philanthropic Community Art Initiative for All Ages

On Sat May 28th, children and adults of all ages can participate in the very first installment of the 'Get Out And Draw' campaign at the Dormont Public Library in Pittsburgh. Led by the Fabulous Superhero Mr. Buckethead, created by cartoonist Alex Strang in conjunction with Film Director and Producer Leonard A. Lies and his company Dream Catchers Films, Inc., located in Dormont, this event is for 'kids' of all ages.

Mr. Buckethead is a fun-filled, imaginative hero and star of film and comic books, created by game designer and artist Alex Strang. His interactive gamebooks, upcoming film and TV series are being produced by his associate and partner Leonard A. Lies of Dream Catchers Films, Inc. The world of Mr. Buckethead is a fascinating and interactive experience designed to inspire creativity and innovation for everyone.

The Get Out And Draw campaign utilizes Mr. Buckethead and his many colorful companions and adversaries to encourage participants to create their own characters within a stress-free, accessible environment suited for any skill or talent level. This program will be touring in many areas and is kicking off at the Dormont Library located at 2950 West Liberty Ave, Pittsburgh, PA 15216. Telephone 412 - 531 - 8754

The Dormont Public Library is an independent community library located in the South Hills which works to empower, educate, and inspire it's members in the Dormont community and the surrounding Pittsburgh area through a wide offering of social, academic, and community-based programming. These programs have established the Dormont Public Library as a place of learning and growth.

Get Out and Draw includes a charity and philanthropic component, as participants can experience having their work exhibited for the public, having it published in a Gallery Book, and available for purchase. This supports the concept that anyone can potentially express themselves in a healthy way, breaking barriers of peer pressure that often limits creativity, and leading towards a possible career path. A portion of the Sales of the gallery book will be given to a charity of the venue's choice.

Alex Strang is a published game designer, event producer and manga artist. Previous works have included the Movie Plotz Improv Game, The Puppet Karaoke Universe Show and the popular Super Giant Monster Showdown strategy game. This Glasgow native now resides in Philadelphia.
Piloted by Film Maker and owner Leonard A. Lies, Dream Catchers Films, Inc., has been an active member of the film industry since 1981. Since that time Leonard has established himself as a dedicated and inspired director, producer, writer and editor. Leonard's background experience includes work on theatrical films, commercials, documentaries and educational productions. Leonard is a Pittsburgh native.
LINKS:
Dormont Public Library:
http://dormontlibrary.org/

Alex Strang:
https://www.facebook.com/AlexanderLeslieStrang

Dream Catchers Films, Inc:
http://dreamcatchersfilmsinc.com/

Mr. Buckethead On Blupela:
https://www.blupela.com/initiative.php?id=477/GET-OUT-AND-DRAW-CREATIVITY-FOR-KIDS-OF-ALL-AGES
results.name: KID FRIENDLY! GET OUT AND DRAW PROGRAM plus MEET MR. BUCKETHEAD!  (DORMONT area)

results.description:

Join us for pick-up games of sand volleyball located on the 4 sand courts at Highland Park, right behind the pool. The courts are first come, first serve and they have no out of bounds lines. We'll have to bring a set lines or draw them in the sand.


Recreational play, so all skill levels are welcome.  While we encourage you to have knowledge of the basics (bump, set, spike), most importantly, we're here to have fun!

results.description:
When you're born in India and immigrate to the U.S., it can be hard to find a place to fit in. Using his quirky attitude and intelligent comedy, Comedian Krish Mohan tries to find where he fits in.

Krish will be performing his one hour show called "An Indian Comedian: How Not To Fit In" at Hambone's in Pittsburgh, PA along with local openers.


Krish has toured across the MidWest, South, Northeast and Mid Atlantic regions and has opened for various nationally touring headliners including Lee Camp, Stewart Huff & Cameron Esposito. Audiences have called Krish's show "brilliant", "hilarious" and "refreshing" as he "skewers mainstream American ignorance: a nation of foreigners doesn't seem to know what to make of them". Find out where he fits in; Is it with Americans or the Indians in the U.S?

"an honest, funny approach to describe how his expectations of moving to America didn't line up with reality; how he has handled racism; his relationship with his parents who raised him to be a devout Hindu, yet he is no longer faithful; and even sex education" -NUVO (Indianapolis)

"If you appreciate comedians that deliver a message with style and truth, and make you LOL while they're delivering the message, then go see the Indian Comedian, unless of courseyou're racist." -Randy Clark from IndyFringe Talks

"wry observations about how he's treated in America as an immigrant, though he uses where he was born and what he looks like as a jumping-off point, not a crutch" -IndyStar

Featuring: Derek Minto
Hosted by: Garrett Titlebaum
*This is a live CD Recording for Krish's upcoming album*

Tickets: $10 cover at the door. 

For more information and advance tickets, please visit
http://krishmohanpgh.bpt.me/

Krish's show at Hambone's on May 28 is also mentioned in Pittsburgh City Paper's Short List of recommended events for the week of May 25- June 1   http://www.pghcitypaper.com/pittsburgh/short-list-may-25-june-1/Content?oid=1924043

Check out this interview Krish did with Brian on River's Edge about the upcoming show on March 28 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9VY_t5REcuQ&feature=youtu.be

Check out this example video of Krish performing at different venues.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=byAmU73bYUs#t=0

For more information about Hambone's, please visit http://www.hambonespittsburgh.com/ Here is the menu http://www.hambonespittsburgh.com/bars/menu.cfm?id=990
<a href="http://www.hambonespittsburgh.com/"></a>

results.description:
The biggest float of the year! Bring your inner tube / kayak and a floating cooler with your drinks and food. Bring friends if you would like or meet some new friends out of the hundreds of people on the creek that day! B.y.o.b. the meeting point will be behind deep well drilling in zelienople. The float takes all day so find your baby sitters and have an adult day!

This is a slow moving creek, so the float is like a lazy river at times. There is shallow spots you'll have to walk a few feet. There is a few deep spots that you can not touch.

Note: you and nobody else but you are responsible for your own belongings, that means if you are planning on bringing electronics with you, make sure they are waterproof...ed and sealed.. I'd hate for anyone's time to be ruined from the stress of losing something or breaking something. Respect your fellow floaters, make new friends, and be safe! Also, please do not throw trash anywhere but a garbage bag, and most importantly don't slap the fish!

AGAIN we are NOT responsible for anyone's anything or property. Float at your own risk!

For everyone who is asking the location: If you know where the zelienople air port is Deep well is before the airport , it will be easy to see where to park and get in behind the building ( 307 W New Castle St, Zelienople, PA 16063 is the address it's giving me.) everyone usually starts floating around 9-11 the float takes about 8 hours depending on how many times you would like to stop at different places on the creek. You can end in Fombell after the lumber yard.( w. 115 fombell road fombell, pa 16123) (There are many different locations along the creek that you can end at but please be aware that there are people's properties along the creek and to respect that.)

You will need a vehicle at the start of the float and one at the end of the float.

Please be aware of your trash. Don't let it float down creek. If you do see some please if possible pick it up.

Apologies for any late responses we are trying our best to keep up with all of the questions and comments.
We did not think this event would become so big so bare with us!


RELEASE OF LIABILITY. BY READING AND AGREEING TO ATTEND THE PUBLIC FLOAT ON MEMORIAL DAY I/WE HEREBY ASSUME ALL OF THE RISKS OF PARTICIPATING IN ANY/ALL ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FREE PUBLIC FLOAT EVENT, including by way of example and not limitation, any risks that may arise from negligence or carelessness on my part or the part of others participating in the float being released, from dangerous or defective equipment or property owned, maintained, or controlled by them/me without fault. I/we WAIVE, RELEASE, AND DISCHARGE from any and all liability, including but not limited to, liability arising from the negligence or fault of the entities or persons released, for my death, disability, personal injury, property damage, property theft, or actions of any kind which may hereafter occur to me including my traveling to and from this public float by agreeing to participate in the float I/we HOLD HARMLESS, AND PROMISE NOT TO SUE the entities or persons mentioned in this event feed or float from any and all liabilities or claims made as a result of participation in this activity, whether caused by the negligence of release or otherwise. I/WE CERTIFY THAT I/WE HAVE READ THIS DISCLAIMER AND I/WE FULLY UNDERSTAND ITS CONTENT. I/WE are AWARE THAT THIS IS A RELEASE OF LIABILITY AND I/WE PLAN TO ATTEND THE FLOAT ON MEMORIAL DAY OF MY OWN FREE WILL AND WILL FLOAT AT MY OWN RISK ON THE RIVER/CREEK.

When: Sunday, May 29, 2016.

Time: 10:00-8:00 pm (or however long it takes you to float)

Starting Location: Zelienople Airport, 307 W New Castle St, Zelienople, PA 16063

Ending location: Fombell after the lumber yard (W. 115 Fombell Road, Fombell, pa 16123)

Transportation: YOU are responsible for your own transportation to and from the starting and ending point, you will need to get back to the starting point so make arrangements to have a car at the ending point.

Floats: Bring anything that you can float on for the day, yes kayaks, yes anything small, yes coolers, we don’t own the river/creek so you can bring what you would like however please take into consideration others that will be on inner tubes as to not hog up the river.

Food/Drink: YOU are responsible for your own food and drink during the float, anyone can make a pit stop for a bite to eat. Take water. Obey the laws. PLEASE BRING TRASH BAGS – DO NOT LITTER IN OUR WATERS!!!!! RESPECT. Be sure you have a floatable cooler or you will be hungry and thirsty…YOU are responsible for your own actions.

Children: This is a public river/creek, and a public float, YOU are the only one that can make the decision if you want to bring your child/children, it is YOUR responsibility to ensure the safety and wellbeing of YOU and YOUR child/children. (Age appropriate adults do consume adult beverages, adult conversions do occur, 95% are not child appropriate, adult language, the river brings out the freedom in us all just saying).

Pit Stops: There are many different locations along the creek that you can stop for a break, but please be aware that there are people's properties along the creek and to RESPECT that. If you are on someone’s PRIVATE Property, YOU are responsible to act like an adult and kindly remove yourself from that person’s property.

Water: This is a river/creek so it all depends on the weather how deep it will be on float day. Mostly it is knee deep however can be deeper in some parts and lower in others. Don’t drink the water no matter how thirst you are…………………. If you can’t swim, wear a life jacket! Wear appropriate water shoes, never know what you will step on.


Common Sense: Be respectful of your fellow floaters at all times, help one another. If you have a phone, bring a waterproof case, if you have keys bring a waterproof case, don’t wear anything expensive, bring sunblock, sun hat, have fun, make new friends, have fun and have more fun……………….most importantly don’t smack the fish . If you CAN’T SWIM – wear a floatation device.

ENJOY OUR RIVERS, MOTHER NATURE, FRIENDS, FLOATS, AND MORE!!!

Thank you,

Tieraney, Lucy and Bree!
results.name: Memorial Weekend Float

results.description:
Join us for our weekly regular season Sunday Morning Social City Skate.

This Sunday will be a special skate as part of the OPEN STREETS Pittsburgh event. We will skate into downtown and join the Open Streets route at Market Square, Skate out Penn Ave. Thru the Strip District to Doughboy Square at Penn Ave. / Butler St. Then out Butler Street thru Lawrenceville to 47th St. The streets will be closed to traffic and open to all pedestrians, walkers, skaters, cyclists,families, etc... The route will be about 4 miles long from Downtown to L'ville. There will be activities, performance areas, food, sidewalk cafe's, entertainment, kids activities, and more. come out and skate or ride with us for this special event skate.

This is an intermediate level social skate of 10-15 mile, mostly flat route, with minor inclines at bridges, ramps and other similar areas. Enjoying the scenic views of the Southside, Strip District, downtown, Station Sq., Mexican War Streets and Northside.   An optional coffee stop is included near the end of the skate.

The intermediate skater should be comfortable skating in street traffic, braking on both flat and inclines and manueving curbs, pot holes, etc.    The steepest hills are the bridge decks and the 10-15 miles are at a relaxed paced.

This skate is a slightly more challenging then the Wednesday advanced beginner skate.

Skate will be led and patrolled by the National Skate Patrol.

Cyclists are welcome and encouraged to join. Also a good way to try the Sunday Skate route on your bike if you haven't skated it before.

Skate is weather permitting.  If it is dry we should be skating!
results.name: OPEN STREETS Pittsburgh MAY 29th- Sunday Morning Social City Skate.  9am to NOON

results.description:
Hi All,

We're meeting at 10:30 AM at the tennis court of Cranberry Community park and will play 2 hours or more. 
If there are some people who want to play some tennis, please bring your racket and let's play together.

This is the event for all levels. 
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Here is some guide I want to share with members. 

 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 TENNIS MEETUP RULES

1. Always RSVP before you come to the event. This helps in organizing and for reserving the courts. Note, without RSVP you may not have a spot.

2. If you RSVPed "Yes" and later decided to not come, please change the RSVP to "No" so the first member on the waiting list can get your spot.

3. Members are expected to arrive on time and stay for the duration. If you expect to be late more than 15 minutes, please send a text message to the posted organizer's phone number.

4. We will practice and always play a game - doubles or singles, depending on the number of members who come to the event.

5. The organizer will try to pair the teams based on skill levels but this may not always be possible and the pairing may be on a first-come-first-serve basis.

6. If you are a member on the waiting list, please don't come until there is cancellation and you moved in to the RSVP list of the event. 
  ----------------------------------------------------------------------------

  Jason,
results.name: Sunday morning tennis for all levels - Cranberry

results.description:
Please sign up if you're planning on playing and bring your favorite games!  Newbies are very welcome.  We have some great teachers to help you get started on your gaming adventure.  Let us know when you sign up what game(s) you'll be bringing.  On Sundays there is plenty of free parking on the side streets and even right on Murray.  Crazy Mocha serves great coffee, specialty drinks, snacks and pastries.  They do allow us to bring food in if we take our trash with us. We usually play all day, break for dinner around 6:00, then it's back to gaming until everybody poops out. 

Incidentally, many of our regular players no longer bother to sign up (but I really wish they would!), so if it looks like only  one or two people are coming, there could actually be quite a few more.  Remember, I will always cancel a game Meetup if we aren't gaming that day, so you won't be sitting there all by yourself waiting for a friend.    And please, remember to change your rsvp to no if you can't make it that day!

$1.00 will be charged to help cover the fee Meetup charges and to buy games for the group.  Join us and let the games begin!!!

results.description:
FREE BUS TOURS OF THE HOMEWOOD CEMETERY are available as part of the Annual Memorial Day Services! The bus tour will cover much of the almost 200 acres of monuments and landscape that comprise historic Homewood Cemetery. The tour will focus on the stories of veterans of conflicts from The American Revolution up through World War II. The bus tours are free but you MUST call the cemetery to make reservations:[masked]-1822. Tours are slated for 11am, noon, 1pm and 3pm.

Here is the official description of the rest of the event, all of which is free and open to the public: Colonel Tom Stokes, United States Army Reserves, will serve as keynote speaker for The Memorial Day Program at The Homewood Cemetery. The program will begin at 2pm on Sunday, May 29 with a Bagpipe procession followed by a P.O.W./M.I.A. Remembrance Ceremony performed by the American Legion Riders, Gold Star Post 820. American Legion Honor Guard Post 820 will place the Wreath of Tribute with gun salute and taps. Veterans in attendance are encouraged to wear their uniforms.
Before and after the official program, The Homewood Cemetery Historical Fund will offer a tour of the cemetery focusing on the lives of specific veterans as well as the history of Memorial Day and the evolution of the military’s involvement with burial and remembrance of its veterans. The tours will be by bus and will leave on the hour starting at 11AM and continuing through 3pm with a break at 2pm for the official ceremony. The tours are free of charge but reservations are required and can only be made by calling the cemetery at[masked]-1822. Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall and Museum will provide a representative from their Footlocker Program both before and after the official program. The Footlocker Program uses touchable artifacts to discuss a soldier’s life in war including the equipment they carried, and the experiences they went through.
results.name: Memorial Day Services & Veterans' Bus Tours at The Homewood Cemetery

results.description: Join us at Wind in the Willows Acupuncture for Restorative Yoga. Restorative yoga practice is designed to restore the nervous system and help release deeply held tensions from the body and mind. As a result of a restorative practice, the nervous system will send and receive fewer messages, triggering the parasympathetic nervous system which is responsible for balancing the body. Deep restorative work improves range of motion and joint mobility, reduces pain and the effects of stress. We use props such as blocks, blankets and straps to support the postures, while gently stretching and strengthening the body. This class is appropriate for students of all ages, shapes and experience levels.

results.description:
Join us on Tuesdays for American Mah Jong! Folks begin arriving around 5PM, and play begins table by table as soon as we have three or four players plus a set.  (We usually have 3-5 tables.)  By 6:15 or so, most players have arrived. We rotate among the tables... at the end of each game, East walks around to see if another table is close to the end of their game, so that two players can swap places.   At the other end of the evening... play must end by 9PM when Panera closes.  Tables begin wrapping up play any time after 8:15 or so.


If you have never played, or if you have not played for a very long time, we highly recommend that you take a Mah Jong 101 beginner class before playing with us - beginner classes are offered every few months.  Mah jong is a wonderful game, but it's hard to learn by just watching others play!


Please order your 2016 card from the National Mah Jongg League, here: http://www.nationalmahjonggleague.org/ Amazon.com also carries the cards. Note that you want the NMJL card, and no other! (There are some colorful alternatives out there.. but we play NMJL card and rules.)

Experienced players -- please bring your cards and please bring a set if you have one.

Please do not bring any outside food or beverages into Panera! Instead, please plan to buy *something* from Panera, even if it's just a beverage or a cookie, to support their willingness to host us.

results.description:
Prompt for this week's meeting:

I exist without knowing how. My existence itself is a question to which I am obliged to respond, whether or not I so wish. My response is in the way I exist at the very moment, and the kind of action in which I am engaged. At every degree of awareness my response is strictly conditioned by my state of being. The  challenge in the question is always new. It is the response that is old, creating a separation from the question. This is because in the response the ordinary “I” is in play.

Madame De Salzmann, The Reality of Being

(Not a Formal Meetup.) How can exercise be relaxing, de-stressing and fun ALL at the same time?
This special class teaches pain release, injury prevention and core strengthening. Attention is placed on proper alignment and appropriate exercise selection.
Pilates is a method of exercise that focuses on Relaxation (learning to move without tension. Ideally using only the correct movements each time you exercise), Concentration (concentration on the correct movements each time you exercise) and Precision ("do not sacrifice knowledge to speed"...Joseph Pilates)
This method consists of low-impact flexibility, muscular strength and endurance movements which emphasize use of the "core"...abdominals, lower back, hips and thighs.

Format 
6v6 (Coed 6's: 3 Males/3 Females). You may always play with more than the minimum number of females.

This league plays a round robin regular season with game times rotating from 7-8-9 PM. A full season schedule and standings will be available on sportsmonster.net by week 2.


Playing surface and what to wear: 
Brand new hardwood! Athletic shoes required.

These leagues are happening!

Full Team Registration 
*Want to Register as a Full Team? -- If you want to register a full team, you can do so but roster size MUST be at least 8. And yes, you can pay for all 8 here. If players are signing up on their own, have each player/group be sure to reference one another so we know to place you together -- see questions when you RSVP.


When will I find out which team I'm on? 
Once a team is formed, a roster will be provided to all the players and we ask someone from the team to volunteer to act as captain to ensure a full team is showing up each week and a positive vibe is maintained throughout the season. 

Don't have PayPal? You may register through sportsmonster.net and pay by check or money order but you will be paying full value as presented on that site.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
